title: Lightning: Nature's Spark Plug
description: A micro-lesson that makes Lightning: Nature's Spark Plug usable.

hook.text: Lightning strikes Earth about 8 million times per day. Each bolt is hotter than the Sun's surface.

buildup.text: Inside a thundercloud, ice particles collide and build up static charge â€” positive top, negative bottom.

discovery.text: When the charge difference gets big enough, electricity arcs through the air at 300,000 km/h.

twist.text: The flash you see is actually the return stroke â€” electricity rushing back up from the ground.

climax.text: Lightning kills about 2,000 people per year worldwide and starts thousands of wildfires.

punchline.text: Every thunderstorm is an electric machine running on ice and gravity.
